result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric John Gruber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric John Gruber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Eric John Gruber
Current: 1309 14th Ave, Monroe, WI 53566 United States  (Effective: 05-05-2017)
Prior: 560 W. 21st Street, #53, Monroe, WI 53566

Eric John Gruber, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant pleads no contest, sentenced to $200 fine plus costs. Payment plan, 100/mo.

Violation - Bail Jumping-Misd.  Issuing Agency - Monroe PD.
  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.    May not enter establishments that sell intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.  Except when present at employment with brewery where intoxicants can be handled but not consumed.

Eric John Gruber, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.
